result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Roberto Guerrero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done. Pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 6-1-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
The first 10 days is straight time - the balance with Huber for the Day Reporting Program - no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program. Credit for 81 days time served.
Court advises defendant may not possess a firearm, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Roberto Guerrero

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, and pay the DNA surcharge, if not previously done, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction - the first 10 days is straight time - the balance with Huber for the Day Reporting Program - no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program and 81 days credit; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 6-1-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Kenneth Roberto Guerrero in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Kenneth Roberto Guerrero in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Attorney Darryl E Smith in court, defendant Kenneth Roberto Guerrero not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced.  Defense counsel requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for plea/sentencing in Branch 44.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Roberto Guerrero in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Kenneth Roberto Guerrero in custody. Step Nolten for Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Kenneth Roberto Guerrero in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Kenneth Roberto Guerrero in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Defendant in Custody. OTP from MSDF.
